main_definition: To watch or notice something carefully.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To see or witness an event, action, or phenomenon.
meanings_and_examples.example: I will observe the stars tonight through my telescope.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take note of particular details in order to understand a situation better.
meanings_and_examples.example: The scientist observed the behavior of ants for hours, noting their movements and interactions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To abide by or adhere to rules, regulations, or instructions.
meanings_and_examples.example: Passengers are required to observe silence during takeoff and landing on the aircraft.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To pay attention to something in order to gain insights or learn from it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher asked students to observe his demonstration carefully before attempting the experiment themselves.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To notice and acknowledge a particular trend, pattern, or change over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: Environmentalists observed an increase in air pollution levels due to industrialization.
